rules.natural: Provided that the researcher mastered statistics skill, the researcher uses the open science platform.
Whenever the paper is submitted to a high impact journal, if it is not the case that the researcher mastered statistics skill, then the researcher collaborated with a statistician.
Under the condition that the preprint of the paper is published, the paper is not plagiarized.
If the professor is tenured, then given that the paper is not accepted in a reputable journal, the preprint of the paper is published.
Should the researcher be promoted, then provided that the paper is not accepted in a reputable journal, the preprint of the paper is published.
In the event that the professor is grant funded, the professor is tenured.
If the researcher is research recognized, then the researcher is promoted.
Whenever the researcher received an award, the professor is grant funded.
Either the researcher received an award or the paper achieved citation.
Given that the researcher meets the tenure track condition, then either the researcher has programming skill or the project is research successful.
If the paper achieved citation, then the paper has an influential finding.
Whenever the paper has an influential finding, the researcher is research recognized.
Either the paper is published in a predatory journal or, if the paper is peer reviewed, then under the condition that the paper is not accepted in a reputable journal, the paper is not plagiarized.
If the paper is retracted, then it is not the case that the paper is corrected.
Either the paper is retracted or the paper is submitted to a high impact journal.
Whenever the allegation is investigated, then if the paper is retracted, the paper is corrected.
Either the journal is published in predatory or the researcher meets the tenure track condition.
If the paper is accepted in a reputable journal, then it is not the case that the journal is published in predatory.
Provided that the author appealed the decision, the author withdrew the submission.
If the researcher uses the open science platform, then whenever the author has access to the research platform, the project is research successful.
Given that it is not true that, provided the paper is not accepted in a reputable journal, the paper is not plagiarized, then the author appealed the decision.
Under the condition that it is false that, if the paper is not accepted in a reputable journal, then the paper is not plagiarized, it is not the case that the author withdrew the submission.
If it is not the case that the researcher mastered statistics skill, then the researcher did not collaborate with a statistician.
Provided that the paper is not submitted to a high impact journal, the paper is rejected by a high impact journal.
Whenever the paper is not submitted to a high impact journal, it is not the case that the paper is rejected by a high impact journal.
If the paper is not accepted in a reputable journal, then the paper is plagiarized.

(A1 ∨ G).natural: Either the researcher has programming skill or the project is research successful.

(A10 → A9).natural: Provided that the researcher mastered statistics skill, the researcher uses the open science platform.

(A12 → (¬A10 → A11)).natural: Whenever the paper is submitted to a high impact journal, if it is not the case that the researcher mastered statistics skill, then the researcher collaborated with a statistician.

(A14 → ¬A5).natural: Under the condition that the preprint of the paper is published, the paper is not plagiarized.

(A15 → (¬A4 → A14)).natural: If the professor is tenured, then given that the paper is not accepted in a reputable journal, the preprint of the paper is published.

(A15 ∨ A16).natural: Either the professor is tenured or the researcher is promoted.

(A16 → (¬A4 → A14)).natural: Should the researcher be promoted, then provided that the paper is not accepted in a reputable journal, the preprint of the paper is published.

(A17 → A15).natural: In the event that the professor is grant funded, the professor is tenured.

(A17 ∨ A18).natural: Either the professor is grant funded or the researcher is research recognized.

(A18 → A16).natural: If the researcher is research recognized, then the researcher is promoted.

(A19 → A17).natural: Whenever the researcher received an award, the professor is grant funded.

(A19 ∨ A20).natural: Either the researcher received an award or the paper achieved citation.

(A2 → (A1 ∨ G)).natural: Given that the researcher meets the tenure track condition, then either the researcher has programming skill or the project is research successful.

(A20 → A18).natural: Under the condition that the paper achieved citation, the researcher is research recognized.

(A20 → A21).natural: If the paper achieved citation, then the paper has an influential finding.

(A21 → A18).natural: Whenever the paper has an influential finding, the researcher is research recognized.

(A22 → (¬A4 → ¬A5)).natural: Provided that the paper is peer reviewed, then if the paper is not accepted in a reputable journal, it is not the case that the paper is plagiarized.

(A23 ∨ (A22 → (¬A4 → ¬A5))).natural: Either the paper is published in a predatory journal or, if the paper is peer reviewed, then under the condition that the paper is not accepted in a reputable journal, the paper is not plagiarized.

(A24 → A25).natural: Should the paper be retracted, then the paper is corrected.

(A24 → ¬A25).natural: If the paper is retracted, then it is not the case that the paper is corrected.

(A24 ∨ A12).natural: Either the paper is retracted or the paper is submitted to a high impact journal.

(A26 → (A24 → A25)).natural: Whenever the allegation is investigated, then if the paper is retracted, the paper is corrected.

(A3 ∨ A2).natural: Either the journal is published in predatory or the researcher meets the tenure track condition.

(A4 → ¬A3).natural: If the paper is accepted in a reputable journal, then it is not the case that the journal is published in predatory.

(A7 → A6).natural: Provided that the author appealed the decision, the author withdrew the submission.

(A8 → G).natural: Under the condition that the author has access to the research platform, the project is research successful.

(A9 → (A8 → G)).natural: If the researcher uses the open science platform, then whenever the author has access to the research platform, the project is research successful.

(¬(¬A4 → ¬A5) → A6).natural: If it is not the case that, when the paper is not accepted in a reputable journal, the paper is not plagiarized, then the author withdrew the submission.

(¬(¬A4 → ¬A5) → A7).natural: Given that it is not true that, provided the paper is not accepted in a reputable journal, the paper is not plagiarized, then the author appealed the decision.

(¬(¬A4 → ¬A5) → ¬A6).natural: Under the condition that it is false that, if the paper is not accepted in a reputable journal, then the paper is not plagiarized, it is not the case that the author withdrew the submission.

(¬A10 → A11).natural: Should the researcher not have mastered statistics skill, then the researcher collaborated with a statistician.

(¬A10 → ¬A11).natural: If it is not the case that the researcher mastered statistics skill, then the researcher did not collaborate with a statistician.

(¬A12 → A13).natural: Provided that the paper is not submitted to a high impact journal, the paper is rejected by a high impact journal.

(¬A12 → ¬A13).natural: Whenever the paper is not submitted to a high impact journal, it is not the case that the paper is rejected by a high impact journal.

(¬A4 → A14).natural: Under the condition that the paper is not accepted in a reputable journal, the preprint of the paper is published.

(¬A4 → A5).natural: If the paper is not accepted in a reputable journal, then the paper is plagiarized.

(¬A4 → ¬A5).natural: Given that the paper is not accepted in a reputable journal, it is not the case that the paper is plagiarized.

A12.natural: The paper is submitted to a high impact journal.

A2.natural: The researcher meets the tenure track condition.

A4.natural: The paper is accepted in a reputable journal.

A8.natural: The author has access to the research platform.

A9.natural: The researcher uses the open science platform.

¬A1.natural: It is not the case that the researcher has programming skill.

¬A23.natural: The paper is not published in a predatory journal.

¬A24.natural: It is not the case that the paper is retracted.

¬A3.natural: It is not the case that the journal is published in predatory.
